subject: Football
Stadiums and Arenas
lead_paragraph: The Dallas Cowboys wrested the title of the N.F.L.’s most valuable franchise from the Redskins, knocking Washington off the top of the list for the first time in eight years, according to Forbes magazine’s survey. Thanks to a new $1 billion stadium set to open in 2009, the Cowboys’ value increased by 28 percent to $1.5 billion. With their climb from third, Dallas passed the Redskins ($1.467 billion) and New England ($1.199 billion). Both New York teams had big jumps because of a planned stadium that they will share. The Giants moved to 8th from 15th with a 9 percent increase to $974 million. The Jets went to 10th from 19th with a 10 percent increase to $967 million.
